page.title: 07SOFT FRUIT AT BERE FERRERS
page.content: Bere Ferrers used to be important for strawberries, raspberries, black and red cherries and gooseberries etc. Now the horticulture has decreased considerably and trees have even been planted in place of orchards. Most emphasis is on "pick your own." One lady takes the first two weeks' crop to sell to the market in Plymouth and whilst the "pick your own"season is on,sells to the pickers. "It was a pleasant morning when we picked our own.We began by walking down a lane and on the right was the produce shed.We were given some punnets to collect our strawberries in.Some people found huge strawberries : some were ripe and some were squashy and over-ripe.We had to bend down to pick them and we decided we would not like to pick all day for our living.My two punnets cost me 32p .
